events.title: Start of the Great Fall of the Bastille
events.description: The storming of the Bastille prison in Paris, marking the beginning of the French Revolution.
events.significance: This event symbolizes the uprising against the monarchy and the fight for freedom and democracy in France.

events.title: Execution of the Romanov Family
events.description: Tsar Nicholas II of Russia, along with his family, was executed by Bolshevik forces during the Russian Civil War.
events.significance: Marked the definitive end of the Russian imperial dynasty and solidified Bolshevik control, shaping the future Soviet Union.

events.title: Beginning of the Potsdam Conference
events.description: Allied leaders Churchill, Truman, and Stalin meet to discuss post-World War II order and peace treaties.
events.significance: Decisions made here influenced the geopolitical landscape of Europe and the Cold War tensions.

events.title: Opening of Disneyland
events.description: The Disneyland theme park officially opens in Anaheim, California.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of modern theme parks and had a major impact on entertainment and tourism.

events.title: Launching of Voyager 2 Spacecraft
events.description: NASA's Voyager 2 spacecraft is launched to study outer planets and interstellar space.
events.significance: Provided invaluable data on the outer planets and is one of the furthest human-made objects from Earth.
